results.title: Hostage
results.creator_credit: Portman Entertainment Group, Independent Image, Tyne Tees Television, Jorge Estrada Mora Producciones, Tom Kinnimont and Robert Young
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “No place to hide” by Ted Allbeury, “Hostage” is about a man on the run, a man who wants nothing more to do with the life of a British Secret Service Agent. A professional killer who murders in the name of Queen and country, John Rennie (Sam Neill) has one more job to do. A senior defence analyst is taken hostage by terrorists and it is up to Rennie to secure the release of the hostage and eliminate the terrorists. This leads him to Argentina, to secrecy and corruption, violence and seduction and eventually to the fatal mistake of falling in love. Plans start to fall apart, doubts begin to set in and Rennie’s questioning of his orders make him a liability - a danger to National Security. Cast also includes Talisa Soto, James Fox, Art Malik, Cristina Higueras, Michael Kitchen, Jean Pierre Reguerraz.

results.title: Host
results.brief_description: Lucas states: In this video, I participate in an on-line therapy session directed by the system operator of a streetside multi-media kiosk. As I indulge in a virtual conversation about a troublesome relationship, the session instantly becomes an amalgamation of daytime television and tabloid, wherein the surveillance camera becomes the eye of the media.

results.title: Hospitals don't burn down
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Peter Johnson and Brian Trenchard-Smith
results.brief_description: A disturbingly realistic film about a fire in a high-rise hospital. It dramatically portrays the horror and awful consequences of such a tragedy. Demonstrates the results of good and bad training and the need for all personnel to learn basic drills and routines in case of fire. Cast includes Jeanne Drynan, Mark Edwards, Ray Marshall, Ralph Cotterill, Ken Goodlet.

results.title: Hospitals and everything like that
results.brief_description: Designed to allay children’s fears of the hospitalisation process. Follows a young girl suffering from an asthmatic complaint as she checks into the hospital and is given routine check-ups and special tests. Shows the sympathetic and supportive nature of the hospital staff. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Hospital team in action
results.creator_credit: Samaritan Films, Anne Balfour Fraser and Michael Luke
results.brief_description: Through the story of a boy who develops osteomyelitis, and the work of the hospital team which attends him, illustrates the varied skills which together contribute to the healing work of any large hospital.

results.title: Hospital sepsis: a communicable disease
results.creator_credit: Johnson and Johnson and Churchill-Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: Reaffirms the need for stringent precautions against infection in hospitals in face of the present over-reliance on antibiotics. After briefly tracing the history of anti-sepsis in hospitals, a detailed case study of the spread of bacteria from an infected patient pinpoints the major spreaders, reservoirs and multipliers or organisms.

results.title: Hospital school
results.brief_description: At the Lord Mayor Treloar Cripples Hospital and College every facility for the treatment, education and vocational training of physically handicapped children is provided. This film shows the observation ward, the X-ray department, the operating theatres, the massage and exercise room, and the bright airy wards and sunny terraces where the children’s schooling takes place simultaneously with their medical treatment.

results.title: Hospital heroes
results.creator_credit: Royal Children's Hospital and District Health Service Education Centre and Ben Moller
results.brief_description: Going to hospital is often a frightening experience, and in the case of children - a traumatic one too. ‘Hospital heroes’ attempts to demystify this process as it follows three brave children who are going to hospital. Brooke is going into hospital to have a grommet put in her ear; Nicholas takes a trip in an ambulance after suffering an asthma attack; and Anthony has fallen off a bike and injured his head and leg and is carried away in a helicopter. The children are visited by “Agro” and a companion. A resource workbook (prepared by Christine Black) accompanies the video and provides guidance on curriculum ideas related to language, art, science, maths and social studies. Suitable for all primary levels as well as lower secondary level students in relation to mathematics.
